term.name: fascism
term.source: From Italian fasci: groups (of men), in which the Italian Fascist movement began.
term.def: A theory and practice of extreme nationalism that developed originally in Italy and spread throughout other parts of the world. Although fascism was ostensibly opposed to &communism; because it allowed private property (albeit under tight government control), it did not differ in essentials from other forms of 20th-century &collectivism;, &authoritarianism;, or &totalitarianism;.
